properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.access-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Access Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.amazon-s-n-s-client
properties.description: To use the AmazonSNS as the client. The option is a software.amazon.awssdk.services.sns.SnsClient type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.auto-create-topic
properties.description: Setting the auto-creation of the topic

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.configuration
properties.description: Component configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.aws2.sns.Sns2Configuration type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the aws2-sns component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.health-check-consumer-enabled
properties.description: Used for enabling or disabling all consumer based health checks from this component

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.health-check-producer-enabled
properties.description: Used for enabling or disabling all producer based health checks from this component. Notice: Camel has by default disabled all producer based health-checks. You can turn on producer checks globally by setting camel.health.producersEnabled=true.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.kms-master-key-id
properties.description: The ID of an AWS-managed customer master key (CMK) for Amazon SNS or a custom CMK.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.message-deduplication-id-strategy
properties.description: Only for FIFO Topic. Strategy for setting the messageDeduplicationId on the message. It can be one of the following options: useExchangeId, useContentBasedDeduplication. For the useContentBasedDeduplication option, no messageDeduplicationId will be set on the message.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.message-group-id-strategy
properties.description: Only for FIFO Topic. Strategy for setting the messageGroupId on the message. It can be one of the following options: useConstant, useExchangeId, usePropertyValue. For the usePropertyValue option, the value of property CamelAwsSnsMessageGroupId will be used.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.message-structure
properties.description: The message structure to use such as json

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.override-endpoint
properties.description: Set the need for overriding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with the uriEndpointOverride option

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.policy
properties.description: The policy for this topic. Is loaded by default from classpath, but you can prefix with classpath:, file:, or http: to load the resource from different systems.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.profile-credentials-name
properties.description: If using a profile credentials provider, this parameter will set the profile name

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.proxy-host
properties.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the SNS client

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.proxy-port
properties.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the SNS client

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.proxy-protocol
properties.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the SNS client

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.queue-arn
properties.description: The ARN endpoint to subscribe to

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.region
properties.description: The region in which the SNS client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example, ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.secret-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Secret Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.server-side-encryption-enabled
properties.description: Define if Server Side Encryption is enabled or not on the topic

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.session-token
properties.description: Amazon AWS Session Token used when the user needs to assume an IAM role

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.subject
properties.description: The subject which is used if the message header 'CamelAwsSnsSubject' is not present.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.subscribe-s-n-sto-s-q-s
properties.description: Define if the subscription between SNS Topic and SQS must be done or not

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.trust-all-certificates
properties.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.uri-endpoint-override
properties.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.use-default-credentials-provider
properties.description: Set whether the SNS client should expect to load credentials on an AWS infra instance or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.use-profile-credentials-provider
properties.description: Set whether the SNS client should expect to load credentials through a profile credentials provider.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sns.use-session-credentials
properties.description: Set whether the SNS client should expect to use Session Credentials. This is useful in a situation in which the user needs to assume an IAM role for doing operations in SNS.
